skill.name: agent-memory
skill.description: Use this skill when the user asks to save, remember, recall, or organize memories. Triggers on: 'remember this', 'save this', 'note this', 'what did we discuss about...', 'check your notes', 'clean up memories'. Also use proactively when discovering valuable findings worth preserving.
skill.summary: Use this skill when the user asks to save, remember, recall, or organize memories. Triggers on: 'rem...
skill.author: unknown

security_audit.summary: No code execution or network behavior is present. The skill only documents local file organization for memories. No sensitive file access or exfiltration patterns were found.

content.value_statement: You lose important context across sessions. This skill guides you to store, find, and maintain memory files consistently.
actual_capabilities: Defines triggers for when to save or recall memories
Specifies a fixed memory storage path under .claude
Requires frontmatter with summary and dates
Provides ripgrep search workflows for summaries and tags
Outlines save, update, delete, and consolidate steps
limitations: No automation for writing memories is included
Relies on manual file creation and updates
Memory files are gitignored by default
No external syncing or database support

use_cases.title: Track tricky bug fixes
use_cases.description: Store root causes and fixes so you can recall them in future sessions.

use_cases.title: Save research findings
use_cases.description: Capture hard to find facts with summaries for fast retrieval.

use_cases.title: Record decisions
use_cases.description: Keep architectural decisions and rationale in organized memory files.

prompt_templates.title: Save a memory
prompt_templates.prompt: Save a memory about the root cause and fix for the cache invalidation bug. Use a clear summary and today date.

prompt_templates.title: Find relevant notes
prompt_templates.prompt: Check memories for anything about large file processing and list the most relevant summaries.

prompt_templates.title: Organize memories
prompt_templates.prompt: Consolidate related memories about dependency issues into one file and update summaries.

prompt_templates.title: Maintenance update
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the memory about API rate limits with the new limits and add an updated date.

output_examples.input: Save a memory about the worker thread leak cause and fix
output: Added summary and created date in frontmatter
Recorded cause, fix, and affected files

best_practices: Write summaries that make relevance obvious
Use categories and kebab case names

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides file based guidance that works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the storage limits?
faq.answer: Limits depend on your filesystem. The skill itself does not impose size limits.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my repo?
faq.answer: Yes. Memories live under .claude and are gitignored by default.

faq.question: Does it access sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. It only documents where to store memory files you choose to create.

faq.question: What if search commands return nothing?
faq.answer: Check the path, use --no-ignore and --hidden, and confirm summaries exist.

faq.question: How does this compare to a notes app?
faq.answer: It is lightweight and local, but lacks sync, rich UI, and reminders.
